page.title: 05LOCAL COUNTRYSIDE , SEAHAM
page.content: AROUND SEAHAM WE HAVE MANY BEAUTIFUL PLACES WHERE RESIDENTS OFTEN TAKE WALKS.DALTON LE DALE IS A SMALL VILLAGE TO THE SOUTH OF SEAHAM.IT HAS A SAXON CHURCH,ST.ANDREWS,WITH A GRAVEYARD.TINY FLOWERS GROW IN THE CRACKS IN THE STONES.PEOPLE WALK ALONG THE PATHWAY BY THE STREAM AND OFTEN SEE HOLES IN THE BANKS WHERE BADGERS LIVE IN SETS.THERE ARE PUBLIC FOOTPATHS ACROSS FIELDS AND THROUGH WOODS BUT CARE MUST BE TAKEN TO CLOSE FARM GATES SO THAT ANIMALS WILL NOT STRAY.WE SEE MANY WILD FLOWERS SUCH AS GIANT HOGWEED,TALLER THAN US,AND FORGET-ME-NOTS,LIKE TINY BLUE STARS.IN SPRING THE BLOSSOM COVERS THE TREES AND IN AUTUMN THE LEAVES ARE RED AND GOLDEN.SOME FIELDS GLOW A GOLDEN YELLOW.THIS CROP IS CALLED "RAPE" AND THE FARMERS GROW IT FOR ITS SEED OIL.
